lesson.title_and_level: Intermediate - Getting to Know the Beauty Pageant Judges

sentence.idiomatic: I think that it is not very fair of you to do it that way.
He does less work than me, yet his salary is higher than mine. It's really so unfair.
You're so unfair. You give the good things to her, and give the inferior things to me.
My singing is average, I don't compare with you.
This piece of literature is just average, there's nothing original about it.
Her figure is just average. She's not suited to being a model.
He is the judge in this beauty contest.
He is an author. How can he be the judge in a singing competition?
I've heard she has a good relationship with the judges.
A big company sponsored this event.
This art exhibition received a lot of support, so it was a huge success.
If she's not willing to support our plan then just forget it, we can find another sponsor.
No wonder she is so happy lately, it's because she's dating.
No wonder these past few days she's been so good to me, it's because she has a favor to ask of me.

word.literal: to go on a business trip

sentence.idiomatic: He went on a business trip. No wonder I didn't see him yesterday.
He's always leering at the pretty girls at the gym.
If he leers at you again, just hit him.
You're just too much. You'll even look lustfully at other girls right in front of me.
You're so naive--it's incredible that you'll believe what he says.
I was so naive at that time, thinking she was sincerely helping me.
The world is very complicated--don't be so naive.
It's not fair. That graduate student looks so average, and yet she made it to the second round.
Yeah. Her figure is terrible. How could she compare with you?
Exactly. The judges are all blind.
I think she must have connections to the judges or sponsors.
Yeah. Now why didn't I think of that? No wonder the judges are always looking at her lustily, giving her such high scores.
And I thought she was so innocent. You really can't tell she's that kind of person.
Totally. It's disgusting. Oh, here she comes.
Hi. I'm Liu Jia.
You must be happy to make it into the next round of the competition.
Yeah, I totally never imagined I would make it.
We never imagined it either. You're so tight with the judges, next time help us out and put in a good word for us too.
What? I don't know the judges.
Oh. It's OK, the sponsors are fine too.
I'm sorry, I don't understand what you're talking about. I'm leaving now.
Hey, what's your hurry? I still want to ask you what kind of girl the judges like!

word.literal: to put in a good word
